Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Cavaliers are on a six-game win streak.
Cleveland Cavaliers are first in the Eastern Conference with a 27-4 record.
Golden State Warriors are 10th in the Western Conference with a 16-15 record.
The Warriors have an 8-7 record on their home court.
Golden State is 1-3 in one-possession games.
Cleveland leads the Eastern Conference scoring 122.7 points per game while shooting 50.6%.
The Warriors are shooting 44.7% from the field this season.
Dennis Schroder is averaging 16.4 points and 6.1 assists for the Warriors.
Donovan Mitchell is scoring 23.6 points per game and averaging 4.6 rebounds for the Cavaliers.
Warriors' last 10 games: 3-7, averaging 105.2 points, 42.7 rebounds, 26.5 assists, 8.9 steals and 5.5 blocks per game while shooting 42.7% from the field.
Cavaliers' last 10 games: 9-1, averaging 124.1 points, 44.2 rebounds, 31.0 assists, 9.4 steals and 3.6 blocks per game while shooting 49.6% from the field.
Others: Warriors' injuries: Moses Moody (day to day, knee), Brandin Podziemski (day to day, abdominal), Gary Payton II (day to day, calf).
